text: {{Infobox writer | name = Shmuel Yosef Agnon | image = Shmuel Yosef Agnon, 1924.jpg | image_size = 225 | alt = | caption = Shmuel Yosef Agnon, 1924 | pseudonym = | birth_name = Shmuel Yosef Halevi Czaczkes | birth_date = | birth_place = Buczacz, Galicia (now Buchach, Ukraine) | death_date = | death_place = Jerusalem, Israel | resting_place = Mount of Olives Jewish Cemetery | occupation = | language = Hebrew | nationality = Israeli | education = | alma_mater = | period = | genre = Novels, short stories, poetry | subject = | movement = | notableworks = | spouse = Esther Marx | partner = | children = | relatives = | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | module = }} Shmuel Yosef AgnonShmuel Yosef Agnon () (July 17, 1888 â€“ February 17, 1970) was an Israeli writer and winner of the 1966 Nobel Prize in Literature.NobelPrize.org, "Shmuel Yosef Agnon"; retrieved 2012-9-18. He was one of the central figures of modern Hebrew fiction. In Hebrew, he is known by the acronym Shai Agnon. In English, his works are published under the name S. Y.
